<td style="padding-top:20px;padding-left:15px;padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Yesterday, we said that September 2 was a highly unremarkable day on which nothing important ever happened. Of course, many of our readers disagreed and shared some important 9/2 events from history.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 1752, Britain adopted the Gregorian calendar, which means people went to sleep on September 2 and woke up on September 14.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 1945, Japan signed its unconditional surrender on a U.S. battleship, formally ending WWII. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 1969, the first ATM in the U.S. debuted in Long Island, NY. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 1989, Nathaniel was born. Happy belated, Nathaniel. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Till next year.</p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/02/amc-cinemark-lift-curtains-tenets-opening-weekend?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
'Tenet' Will Give Us What no Nolan Film Ever Has
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Movie popcorn and a face mask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzAxL21vdmllX3BvcGNvcm5fYW5kX2FfZmFjZV9tYXNrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Clarity—about the state of the movie industry, that is. <em>Tenet</em> itself, which debuts in U.S. theaters tonight, has <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/08/31/tenet-review-christopher-nolans-most-confusing-movie-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been called</a> Christopher Nolan’s “most confusing movie ever,” and this is the same guy that already turned our brains into oatmeal with <em>Inception</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But will blowing up the basic laws of physics be enough for Warner Bros. to revive a pandemic-stunted box office?</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The stakes are higher than a <em>Cats</em> audience</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Tenet</em> is the first ultra-hyped, made-for-the-big-screen movie to debut in cinemas since theaters started <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/20/coronavirus-amc-regal-and-cinemark-prepare-to-reopen-in-the-us-after-five-month-shutdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lifting the curtains</a> last month. By tonight, 70%+ of AMC and Cinemark locations will be open and following strict cleaning protocols.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The going theory:</strong></span><span> If </span><span><em>this </em></span><span>movie can’t get people off their couches, nothing but a coronavirus vaccine will. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the spirit of Christopher Nolan, this analysis now diverges into two possible timelines...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">It’s a blockbuster:</strong> Strong <em>Tenet</em> ticket sales could help theater owners pay backlogged bills and bring chains like AMC back from the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/amc-shares-rise-as-70percent-of-theaters-will-be-open-this-weekend.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brink of bankruptcy</a>. A successful run is a sign that straight-to-streaming can complement, but not entirely replace, in-person theater viewing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. <strong style="color:#000">It’s a bust:</strong> Skipping theaters for home-viewing could become the industry norm. <em>Trolls World Tour</em> already proved the strategy has legs when it <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/28/trolls-sequel-reportedly-brings-96-million-digital-release?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grossed</a> about $95 million in digital downloads in three weeks in April. <em>Mulan</em> is launching for $30/pop on Disney+ tomorrow. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The long-tail effects: bankruptcies, acquisitions, and an </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/10/movie-industry-uncertain-future-post-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">industry shakeout</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<em>Tenet</em>’s outlook is promising</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The film had a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tenet-suspense-builds-for-theater-chains-11598981394?mod=hp_lista_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strong international showing</a> last weekend, bringing in about $53 million across 41 markets—$13 million above expectations. And <em>Tenet</em>’s advance ticket sales are <a href="https://deadline.com/2020/08/tenet-advance-ticket-sales-us-uk-australia-christopher-nolan-1203024015/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">higher than</a> they were for <em>Interstellar</em> and <em>Dunkirk, </em>per film analytics firm Movio.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The pandemic has put theater chains on the ropes and forced studios to experiment with new formats, like Universal’s deal with AMC to shorten the theatrical window to just 17 days. Could <em>Tenet </em>be the plot twist the industry’s been waiting for?</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEBT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/02/us-debt-forecasted-exceed-gdp-fiscal-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The U.S. Looking at Its Credit Card Bill
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Jordan Peele Gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/LRVnPYqM8DLag/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Jordan Peele Gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/LRVnPYqM8DLag/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Congressional Budget Office just <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/02/politics/cbo-us-debt-projected-to-overtake-gdp/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a> a historic projection for the U.S. economy. It said government debt will reach 98% of GDP in fiscal 2020 (which ends this month), and surpass 100% of GDP the next fiscal year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The debt-to-GDP ratio is used as a way to contextualize countries’ debt loads, and 98% is the </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/09/02/business/stock-market-today-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest it’s been</a></span><span> for the U.S. in generations. The last time U.S. debt exceeded GDP (aka economic output) was in 1946, after the government financed World War II. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As a result of increased government spending and 2017's tax cuts, U.S. debt was on the rise before the pandemic. But the country's finances took two major thwacks early this year: Congress passed trillions in relief spending just as pandemic restrictions dried up government tax revenues. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead..</strong>.most economists and lawmakers <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-debt-is-set-to-exceed-size-of-the-economy-for-year-a-first-since-world-war-ii-11599051137?mod=hp_lead_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agree</a> that another round of relief measures are necessary. But negotiations have been stalled for about a month now, as Democrats push for a $3 trillion plan and Republicans counter with $1 trillion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GENERAL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/02/whats-whats-macys-losses-werent-bad-expected-tesla-shares-actually-fall?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Some Surprising Faces in What’s Up, What’s Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's up</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Epic rallies:</strong> Peloton shares <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/peloton-garners-105-price-target-114519660.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained 9% yesterday</a> after JPMorgan raised its price target for the red-hot fitness brand. Peloton’s stock has more than tripled this year as the workout-from-home movement continues to soak carpets with sweat. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Adding the GOAT to the team:</strong> Michael Jordan <a href="https://www.espn.com/chalk/story/_/id/29793101/michael-jordan-takes-equity-stake-draftkings-becomes-adviser?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined</a> the sports betting company DraftKings in an advisory role after buying an equity stake. DraftKings will get a boost from Jordan’s star power and business acumen, but the White Sox and Wizards preach caution. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Not down as much as we thought: </strong>Macy’s reported a (much smaller than expected) net loss of <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/macys-stock-jumps-after-much-narrower-than-expected-loss-net-sales-beat-2020-09-02?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$431 million</a> in Q2...and online sales rose 53% from last year. CEO Jeff Gennette also announced plans to experiment with <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/macys-plans-rollout-of-smaller-stores-away-from-malls.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smaller stores</a> outside of malls.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s down</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Epic rallies:</strong> It feels weird to type, but Tesla’s stock actually <em>fell.</em> Shares were down <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-stocks/tesla-tumbles-15-as-blistering-rally-cools-idUSKBN25T2UE?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as much as 15%</a> yesterday after a top shareholder, investment management firm Baillie Gifford, reduced its position due to portfolio restrictions.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Extra peanuts: </strong>Facing major turbulence, United announced plans to furlough more than <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/united-airlines-cuts-jobs-as-coronavirus-hurts-air-travel-demand.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">16,300 workers</a> when October rolls around. It’s far less than the 36,000 cuts it warned of in July, but the outlook for airlines remains bleak with demand simmering at 30% of typical levels.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY DIVERSYFUND
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Put That Gold Pan Away
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/474904222;280941622;d" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="DiversyFund" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTA3NC8xNTk4OTc5NzE2LU1vcm5pbmdfQnJld18wOV8wM18yMF9UYWtlb3Zlcl9QcmltYXJ5XzE1MDB4NzAwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For centuries, the uber-wealthy have kept their wealth-growing ways a secret, leaving us normal folk to come up with our own ideas—like sifting through rivers with gold pans or betting the farm on our reality TV show concept, <em>Extreme PB&Jing</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/474904207;280941622;g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">DiversyFund</a> is blowing the lid off <strong style="color:#000">the longest-kept wealth-growing secret</strong>: real estate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A private real estate investment trust (REIT) is considered by many experts to be a smart way to <strong style="color:#000">diversify your portfolio</strong> and <strong style="color:#000">grow your wealth</strong>. For a long time, rich big shots were the only ones with the resources to access this—leaving the unstable, unreliable stock market to the rest of us.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now—with just a <strong style="color:#000">$500 minimum</strong> investment—DiversyFund is helping all investors <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/474904207;280941622;g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">create long-term wealth like the 1%</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Put those gold pans in the closet and forget ’em, friends.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/474904219;280941622;j" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Invest with DiversyFund here</a>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/02/trump-cdc-enacts-emergency-order-prevent-evictions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How We Gonna Pay This Year's Rent?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Cancel rent sign" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjk4L2NhbmNlbF9yZW50X3NpZ24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You may not have to. Tuesday night, President Trump <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/09/01/908581048/sweeping-new-eviction-ban-from-trump-administration?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">enacted</a> an emergency order to prevent evictions through Dec. 31. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why? </strong>More than 20 million renters live in households that have experienced coronavirus-related job losses, the Aspen Institute <a href="https://apnews.com/1eb82db82ec722d329e52eff638c797f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimates</a>. Congress’s March relief package gave renters some insulation from evictions, but those protections have expired. The CDC is worried about a crush of renters losing their shelter and spreading COVID-19. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The protection is only available to </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/02/your-money/eviction-moratorium-covid.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">certain renters</a></span><span>— those with an expected income of <$99,000 and who can show they’ve suffered financial losses because of the pandemic, among other qualifications. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reaction: </strong>Tenant and landlord organizations are...actually <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/cdc-move-to-stop-evictions-draws-heavy-criticism-from-both-sides.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on the same page</a>. Tenant advocates cheered the move, but said what’s really needed is financial assistance so renters don’t get stuck with a giant bill on January 1, 2021. Landlord groups want the same thing, so they can get some help covering insurance, taxes, and payroll.</p>

<tr>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/02/lego-emerges-quarantine-winner-big-sales-growth-h1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lego Isn’t Playing Around
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Lego movie gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/VerIk7pS3iEEg/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The largest toymaker in the world built some serious quarantine momentum, reporting a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2020/sep/02/lego-reports-sales-jump-after-covid-crisis-kept-families-at-home?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">14% rise in sales</a> in the first half of the year. It also read the pandemic instructions on ecommerce—website visits doubled to 100 million. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The growth was fueled by...</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The usual suspects</strong></span><span>: Products from its Harry Potter, Disney Princess, and Star Wars lines were among the best performers.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Some new faces: </strong></span><span>Sales of the most expensive and intricate sets grew 2.5x in the first half of the year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s because it’s not just kids getting in on the action. "We have more than a million adult fans signed up to our website," Lego CEO Niels Christiansen told the BBC. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Despite the huge increase in online traffic, Lego still appreciates bricks...and mortar. The company said it was on track to open <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-53998818?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">120 new store locations</a> around the world this year.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">David Blaine’s was dizzying. Yesterday, the stuntman ascended <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/tv/2020/09/02/david-blaine-live-stream-ascension-magician-lands-balloon-ride/5689717002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">24,900 ft. in the air</a> via balloons in Arizona...or rather, over Arizona. He parachuted down to safety after about 30 minutes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Any final thoughts, Mr. Blaine?</strong> “Wow, that was awesome,” the daredevil said after landing.</p>

<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-airbnb-ackman/airbnb-spurns-approach-from-ackmans-blank-check-company-idUSKBN25T30U?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Airbnb</a></span><span> was reportedly approached by hedge fund manager Bill Ackman about a merger with his special purpose acquisition company (SPAC), but is for now opting for a traditional IPO.</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2000 B.C.E.: </strong>Great Pyramid of Giza<br><strong style="color:#000">1 C.E.: </strong>Also the Great Pyramid of Giza. Gotcha.<br><strong style="color:#000">1885: </strong>Washington Monument <br><strong style="color:#000">1905: </strong>Eiffel Tower <strong style="color:#000"><br>1950: </strong>Empire State Building <br><strong style="color:#000">2010: </strong>Burj Khalifa (in Dubai)<br><strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For more...here's a <a href="https://www.visualcapitalist.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Timeline-of-Tallest-Structures-in-History.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cool infographic</a> on the tallest structures throughout history.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClarity—about the state of the movie industry, that is. \u003cem\u003eTenet\u003c/em\u003e itself, which debuts in U.S. theaters tonight, has \u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2020/08/31/tenet-review-christopher-nolans-most-confusing-movie-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen called\u003c/a\u003e Christopher Nolan’s “most confusing movie ever,” and this is the same guy that already turned our brains into oatmeal with \u003cem\u003eInception\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut will blowing up the basic laws of physics be enough for Warner Bros. to revive a pandemic-stunted box office?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe stakes are higher than a \u003cem\u003eCats\u003c/em\u003e audience\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eTenet\u003c/em\u003e is the first ultra-hyped, made-for-the-big-screen movie to debut in cinemas since theaters started \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/20/coronavirus-amc-regal-and-cinemark-prepare-to-reopen-in-the-us-after-five-month-shutdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elifting the curtains\u003c/a\u003e last month. By tonight, 70%+ of AMC and Cinemark locations will be open and following strict cleaning protocols.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe going theory:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e If \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ethis \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003emovie can’t get people off their couches, nothing but a coronavirus vaccine will. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the spirit of Christopher Nolan, this analysis now diverges into two possible timelines...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s a blockbuster:\u003c/strong\u003e Strong \u003cem\u003eTenet\u003c/em\u003e ticket sales could help theater owners pay backlogged bills and bring chains like AMC back from the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/amc-shares-rise-as-70percent-of-theaters-will-be-open-this-weekend.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebrink of bankruptcy\u003c/a\u003e. A successful run is a sign that straight-to-streaming can complement, but not entirely replace, in-person theater viewing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s a bust:\u003c/strong\u003e Skipping theaters for home-viewing could become the industry norm. \u003cem\u003eTrolls World Tour\u003c/em\u003e already proved the strategy has legs when it \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/28/trolls-sequel-reportedly-brings-96-million-digital-release?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrossed\u003c/a\u003e about $95 million in digital downloads in three weeks in April. \u003cem\u003eMulan\u003c/em\u003e is launching for $30/pop on Disney+ tomorrow. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe long-tail effects: bankruptcies, acquisitions, and an \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/10/movie-industry-uncertain-future-post-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eindustry shakeout\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eTenet\u003c/em\u003e’s outlook is promising\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe film had a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tenet-suspense-builds-for-theater-chains-11598981394?mod=hp_lista_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrong international showing\u003c/a\u003e last weekend, bringing in about $53 million across 41 markets—$13 million above expectations. And \u003cem\u003eTenet\u003c/em\u003e’s advance ticket sales are \u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/08/tenet-advance-ticket-sales-us-uk-australia-christopher-nolan-1203024015/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehigher than\u003c/a\u003e they were for \u003cem\u003eInterstellar\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eDunkirk, \u003c/em\u003eper film analytics firm Movio.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe pandemic has put theater chains on the ropes and forced studios to experiment with new formats, like Universal’s deal with AMC to shorten the theatrical window to just 17 days. width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Congressional Budget Office just \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/02/politics/cbo-us-debt-projected-to-overtake-gdp/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e a historic projection for the U.S. economy. It said government debt will reach 98% of GDP in fiscal 2020 (which ends this month), and surpass 100% of GDP the next fiscal year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe debt-to-GDP ratio is used as a way to contextualize countries’ debt loads, and 98% is the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/09/02/business/stock-market-today-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighest it’s been\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the U.S. in generations. The last time U.S. debt exceeded GDP (aka economic output) was in 1946, after the government financed World War II. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs a result of increased government spending and 2017's tax cuts, U.S. debt was on the rise before the pandemic. But the country's finances took two major thwacks early this year: Congress passed trillions in relief spending just as pandemic restrictions dried up government tax revenues. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead..\u003c/strong\u003e.most economists and lawmakers \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-debt-is-set-to-exceed-size-of-the-economy-for-year-a-first-since-world-war-ii-11599051137?mod=hp_lead_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagree\u003c/a\u003e that another round of relief measures are necessary. But negotiations have been stalled for about a month now, as Democrats push for a $3 trillion plan and Republicans counter with $1 trillion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEpic rallies:\u003c/strong\u003e Peloton shares \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/peloton-garners-105-price-target-114519660.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egained 9% yesterday\u003c/a\u003e after JPMorgan raised its price target for the red-hot fitness brand. Peloton’s stock has more than tripled this year as the workout-from-home movement continues to soak carpets with sweat. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAdding the GOAT to the team:\u003c/strong\u003e Michael Jordan \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/chalk/story/_/id/29793101/michael-jordan-takes-equity-stake-draftkings-becomes-adviser?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejoined\u003c/a\u003e the sports betting company DraftKings in an advisory role after buying an equity stake. DraftKings will get a boost from Jordan’s star power and business acumen, but the White Sox and Wizards preach caution. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNot down as much as we thought: \u003c/strong\u003eMacy’s reported a (much smaller than expected) net loss of \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/macys-stock-jumps-after-much-narrower-than-expected-loss-net-sales-beat-2020-09-02?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$431 million\u003c/a\u003e in Q2...and online sales rose 53% from last year. CEO Jeff Gennette also announced plans to experiment with \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/macys-plans-rollout-of-smaller-stores-away-from-malls.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esmaller stores\u003c/a\u003e outside of malls.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s down\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEpic rallies:\u003c/strong\u003e It feels weird to type, but Tesla’s stock actually \u003cem\u003efell.\u003c/em\u003e Shares were down \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-stocks/tesla-tumbles-15-as-blistering-rally-cools-idUSKBN25T2UE?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas much as 15%\u003c/a\u003e yesterday after a top shareholder, investment management firm Baillie Gifford, reduced its position due to portfolio restrictions.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eExtra peanuts: \u003c/strong\u003eFacing major turbulence, United announced plans to furlough more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/united-airlines-cuts-jobs-as-coronavirus-hurts-air-travel-demand.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e16,300 workers\u003c/a\u003e when October rolls around. It’s far less than the 36,000 cuts it warned of in July, but the outlook for airlines remains bleak with demand simmering at 30% of typical levels.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Tuesday night, President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/09/01/908581048/sweeping-new-eviction-ban-from-trump-administration?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenacted\u003c/a\u003e an emergency order to prevent evictions through Dec. 31. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy? \u003c/strong\u003eMore than 20 million renters live in households that have experienced coronavirus-related job losses, the Aspen Institute \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/1eb82db82ec722d329e52eff638c797f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimates\u003c/a\u003e. Congress’s March relief package gave renters some insulation from evictions, but those protections have expired. The CDC is worried about a crush of renters losing their shelter and spreading COVID-19. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe protection is only available to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/02/your-money/eviction-moratorium-covid.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecertain renters\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e— those with an expected income of \u003c$99,000 and who can show they’ve suffered financial losses because of the pandemic, among other qualifications. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reaction: \u003c/strong\u003eTenant and landlord organizations are...actually \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/02/cdc-move-to-stop-evictions-draws-heavy-criticism-from-both-sides.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon the same page\u003c/a\u003e. Tenant advocates cheered the move, but said what’s really needed is financial assistance so renters don’t get stuck with a giant bill on January 1, 2021. Landlord groups want the same thing, so they can get some help covering insurance, taxes, and payroll.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
